Description: The pest control corporation Terminix International Company LP and its U.S. Virgin Islands operation Terminix International USVI LLC agreed to pay $10 million to settle multiple violations of the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide and Rodenticide Act for illegally applying fumigants containing methyl bromide in multiple residential locations in the U.S. Virgin Islands.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/terminix-companies-agree-pay-10-million-applying-restricted-use-pesticide-residences-us
Notes: Note: This penalty is a duplicate of an amount shown in another record (either because it applies to a multi-location settlement or because Violation Tracker contains an agency record and a settlement announcement for the same case).

Info Source: Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php
Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php

Description: Terminix International Company LP and its U.S. Virgin Islands operation Terminix International USVI LLC were sentenced for violations of the Federal Insecticide, Fungicide, and Rodenticide Act in the U.S. Virgin Islands. They were ordered to pay a total of $9.2 million in criminal fines, community service, and restitution payments.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/terminix-companies-sentenced-applying-restricted-use-pesticide-residences-us-virgin-islands

Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: https://www.epa.gov/newsreleases/us-epa-fines-terminix-168000-misuse-pesticide-products

Description: Pest control company Terminix agreed to pay $100,000 in settlement of allegations it charged consumers for unnecessary services.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20030708104256/http://www.ago.state.ma.us/press_rel/terminix.asp

Description: Terminix International pleaded guilty to a criminal charge of assault related to a botched cocoa-bean fumigation that exposed nine employees to the highly toxic pesticide methyl bromide.
Info Source: http://www.nj.gov/oag/newsreleases06/pr20061012a.html
https://web.archive.org/web/20101119024238/http://www.ag.ny.gov/media_center/2003/sep/sep25a_03.html

Description: Terminix International agreed to pay $1 million in settlement of allegations it violated state environmental law with misuse of pesticides.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20061219061108/http://www.ct.gov/ag/cwp/view.asp?A=1777&Q=283702
https://www.nj.gov/oag/newsreleases06/pr20060320a.html
https://www.attorneygeneral.gov/taking-action/press-releases/ag-shapiro-secures-restitution-for-pa-consumers-in-settlement-with-deceptive-pest-control-company/

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: February 7, 2020 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Info Source: Extracted from a spreadsheet obtained from the NLRB through a Freedom of Information Act request fulfilled on 5/28/2020.

Description: An investigation by the Alabama Attorney General's office and the Alabama Department of Agriculture and Industries revealed that Terminix engaged in a pattern of collecting annual termite protection premiums from Alabama consumers but failed to deliver or provide the termite protection services promised in the contracts consumers had with Terminix. The company agreed to pay $60 million to settle the matter.
Info Source: https://www.alabamaag.gov/NewsViewer/69822281-8337-40ec-8761-d603f91f10a6
